snippet.title: PC-Man - MS-DOS Gameplay (PC Booter)
snippet.description:
A fairly faithful reproduction of the classic Pac-Man arcade game, considering its age and use of CGA graphics. As ever, the main character moves through a maze collecting dots and avoiding ghosts, using power pills for a chance to kill the ghosts for points. And apparently it boots up with some circus music when you load up the menu. PC-Man also happens to use the same maze layout as the PC-8801 version.

Pac-Man (C) Bandai Namco
Developed and published by Orion Software, Inc.

#pcman #pacman #pac_man #msdos #dos #retrogaming #retrogames #namco #bandainamco #theforeseenarcade #pcbooter

FUN FACT: PC-Man was released specifically through the PC Booter format. For those unfamiliar, these games were typically released on floppy disks and required no operating system on the PC. Instead, the disk was inserted and the computer powered on, and it would boot directly into the game. Also, the game still runs at the correct speed even on pentium and higher CPUs. It just takes a long time to figure out what the proper throttle speed is.
